name: Clifftop Walk From Birling Gap to Exceat, South Downs East

ai.summary: A challenging coastal clifftop hike along the South Downs East, covering 22.4 km from Birling Gap to Exceat. Expect dramatic sea views, towering chalk cliffs, and long, steady ascents and descents. The route is exposed with variable footing and weather can make conditions harsh, so thorough preparation is essential.
ai.terrain_summary: Cliff-top trails along chalk cliffs with uneven surfaces, exposed edges, and occasional steps. A mix of narrow paths, field tracks, and farm lanes, with rocky or muddy sections after rain. The scenery is stunning, but footing can be slippery and edges are dangerous in windy conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Expect strong coastal winds and rapidly changing weather. Cliff-edge sections can be unstable or slippery; keep away from the edge and follow signs. Some stretches have limited shelter or escape routes between villages. Start early to ensure daylight, check local weather and any path closures, carry a map and a fully charged phone, and wear sturdy footwear with adequate waterproofing. Inform someone of your plans and ETA.
recommended_gear: Sturdy, waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Layered clothing plus a waterproof outer shell
Windproof jacket and warm layers for sea winds
Hat or cap, sunglasses, and sun cream
Backpack with 2–3 liters of water and snacks
Energy bars or destination-ready food for the distance
Map, compass and/or GPS device; fully charged phone
Lightweight rain cover for the backpack
Walking poles (optional, for stability on uneven sections)
Headlamp or flashlight (for potential delays or low light)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offer milder weather and longer daylight; the route is doable year-round with appropriate gear, but winter conditions can be windy, wet, and more challenging.

seo.title: Clifftop Walk From Birling Gap to Exceat (South Downs East) – 22.4 km Coastal Hike
seo.meta_description: A demanding 22.4 km coastal cliff hike along the South Downs from Birling Gap to Exceat. Learn terrain, safety tips, gear, and best seasons for this stunning UK coastal trek.
